pros: There were great people to work with.

pros: I've been a nurse for a little while and after the initial Covid crisis I literally noticed that the nursing climate really changed. The feel of family was pretty much gone as it became all about the money that could be made. I wanted to work where I had that feeling of home away from home and I believe i've found it here. Family, a warm and inviting staff made all the difference for me.
cons: Nothing applicable at this time.

job_title: Technical Lab Supervisor in Tampa, FL
pros: I was quite impressed with the organizational commitment mission. People here live and breath the mission of "extending the healing ministry of Christ". Orientation was amazing - leaders cast an amazing vision of where the org is headed to and our role in getting there. I was blown away on my first interview by how friendly the people were (the parking lot attendant and Ron at the front desk wished me luck on my interview and showed genuine care). People said hi to me in in the hallway, and offered directions. One lab assistant, actually took me to where I needed to go. From a cultural perspective, I was hooked before I even made it to the interview . . . how does an organization develop this type of customer service in a wide swath of team members? Support and encouragement from my peers and supervisor is amazing, I was made to feel very welcomed and supported. The facility (Taneja Center) looks like you are checking into a plush 5 star hotel, a lot of natural light and windows, open space, again the front desk staff were amazing.
cons: Parking is a far from the entrance, they have shuttles that run like all the time, but if you are walking from your car, plan on 15-20 minute buffer.

review_title: Push for more money in the interview, you wont get a raise after you're hired

cons: Little to no pay increases, lack of communication from management, short staffing

pros: AMAZING coworkers! The reason I didn't tuck tail and run is because the team I worked with was absolutely amazing and you really become a family. Managers 100% have your back and from the housekeeping staff to the Nurse manager, everyone works really well together.
cons: Being understaffed is the rule, not the exception. Not just techs but nurses as well. So there is high stress on a regular basis. My floor had a lot of total care patients and even if you phone a friend, it was very difficult to stay on schedule because chances are, if you phone a friend for help, they are in the same boat and are unavailable to help you. Or if they do, now they are set way back and you're both behind. I can actually count TWO shifts ever that I left work on time. Being an hour over shift-end was the usual.

job_title: New Nurse Graduate in Tampa, FL
pros: Health screening employees were pleasant and explained the process along with the necessary documentation needed in order to complete my medical clearance. A greeter of the hospital had a wonderful attitude, great smile, and was extremely helpful in directing me to the appropriate department. There was a lot of adjustments and changes for the new hire orientation due to COVID-19 but I believe many of the accommodations went smoothly.
cons: The Human Resource Senior Employee Experience Partner (Marcus Broxie) had an impatient attitude when providing me with new hire information. He had poor communication skills and was very dismissive when asked questions. There was an overwhelming amount of information that he instructed me to write down as he quickly spoke them over the phone rather than sending me an email that I could reference. He had inappropriate responses to verbal questions by stating demeaning statements such as, "what did I tell you." He also did not follow up or respond to my email.

pros: AdventHealth Tampa cares about its employees with great benefits and personal development opportunities. review_title: Management Does Not Follow Mission Statement
pros: Pay was within market range. Pay was higher with professional certifications and jobs within critical care units (including surgery).  Free parking.  Wonderful clergy staff, although I’ve heard the department’s incredible Manager was fired—huge mistake.  Faith-based hospital owned by Adventist Health System.
cons: Nurses in surgical areas are overworked and under appreciated.  It’s all about the money and rushing through the surgical processes—PreOp, IntraOp, and PostOp.  Even though the hospital’s Publicity Team puts out great advertisements to the public,  RNs are not encouraged to “live and work” the Mission Statement which is:  To Extend The Healing Ministry Of Christ.  I don’t know about other departments, but nurses in Surgical Services were often miserable, stressed, and unhappy. Big turnover. There were very few Team Leaders with positive attitudes. RNs felt helpless to try and make a “difference”.

review_title: Proper utilization of IT and Informatics personel accountabilites for salary they make.
pros: Strong organization combining medical science, faith,preventative health, and nutrition for proper management of longevity and reduction of long term medical costs to our "system".
cons: Improper evaluation of employees and departments upon obtaining new hospitals to retain employees just because they were there, and improper evaluation of salaries either up or down based on skills, accountability, work history at what they REALLY did before Adventist took over. Management decisions based on nepotism or because of who they know, not the job they do and accompaning salaries fair for those interjected into a department with a higher pay with degree qualifications that do not match.

pros: Having a job, great co-workers who cares about the patients, good manager.
cons: Team leader and constant reminders almost every time I get into work, working too hard for nothing, being scolded at a lot and barely recognized. Treats most employees like they aren't giving everything they got. Concerned about the budget and most of the time telling people who aren't full time workers to flex out early. Seems concerned to keep money in pockets. Doesn't care about what staff say about problems, problems with co-workers who gets away with the same thing. It feels like a broken record every time there's staff meetings, because most of the same stuff is repeated every, single, time. Team leader not taking people's concerns seriously and only cares about self. Most of the time just says to get over it or it's part of the job. I shared a concern one time and team leader didn't care. Just gave an excuse and didn't try to find a solution. Personally, I don't know how much longer I can take it.

pros: Hours are flexible, Offer full-time after 4 months
cons: Not such a good work environment

pros: none at this time. thank you.
cons: A lot of communication break down

review_title: Great Work/Life Balance and Company Culture
pros: The company culture is supportive and accountable.
cons: Some difficult stakeholders to work with but nothing insurmountable.

pros: There are Good leaders that care.
cons: The hospital is in a Bad location

job_title: Health Informatics Specialist in Tampa, FL
pros: AdventHealth offers me the opportunity to coordinate with multiple departments to improve patient care and patient outcomes.
cons: I do not see a downside to working at AdventHealth Tampa.

pros: Supportive management, faith based, reasonable pay, work life balance, flex time
cons: medical insurance seems to be a little more than what I paid at other jobs

pros: I have helpful staff and supervisors.
cons: Work one weekend a month

job_title: Patient Account Representative in Tampa, FL
pros: Laid back, no phones, quiet, easy
cons: Pay, repetitive, no personality, boring

pros: They pretty much leave you alone.
cons:
Low pay
Supervisors do not tell you about route changes until 5 minutes before route, or during route.

job_title: Patient Access Specialist II in Tampa, FL
pros: tuition reimbursement, opportunities to move with system
cons: pay is not competitive, not a great work culture

pros: excellent teamwork and nice location
cons: the facility I work in does not have their own laboratory

pros: The staff are the reason there is quality.
cons:
Administration is corrupt, inept and when it comes to critical thinking, there seem to be no signs of life. From what I have witnessed of others experience and then throwing my own into it I would say it is safe to assume that Florida Hospital will be sued by employees very soon in a class action sort of way. Also, Managers expected to lie, and cheat and push the limits of safety in patient ratios. 

I am a former employee and as soon as my contract was up I got out! I cannot express how deeply upsetting it is to work there. There were many stories of lies, corruption, theft from employees in the way of overtime and PDO that gets taken back and even harassment of the un-favorite employees. I was lucky that I was well received but even in that it was hell to work there.

There are mass layoffs of 30 -70 people at a time and people are leaving willingly in about the same amount of numbers. This is going to be a very bad result for the hospital and to say that most nurses have exit plans is to underestimate the level of unhappiness here.

pros: I was drawn to the organization by the Mission and values ; orientation had me pumped to be apart of this team. For a while , it was good.. I believe the foundation has it right, and there are many great individuals here,  but middle level down ...not so much  ... PDO, benefits, flexibility
cons: Leadership and management play favorites, diversity is a joke; no room for growth , longevity takes precedents over college degrees, pay is not at market value for duties assigned. Depressing  environment negative staff , high turn over  , dress code speaks for itself, employees given t-shirts to wear on game days and some dept managers won’t allow their members to participate which says we are NOT “one team” as CEO prefers.

job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Tampa, FL
pros:
The people and the patients.
I’m reminded daily with my colleagues that everything we do serves a purpose in the care of others in our community.
cons:
National holidays are paid by forced use of PDO. Additional closures around every holiday force you to use more PDO.
Communication is atrocious when there are leadership changes or roles are eliminated. We rarely have any direction on who to contact when someone leaves or is terminated 
This campus is not treated like any other in the region. Benefits at other campuses are not extended to this one
Benefits are restrictive and services mostly only available in the AdventHealth network and the out of pocket is  still very high
No work life balance for 40hr employees. So much room for improvement on work from home or adjusted work schedules.

review_title: It's Okay, I have a job.
job_title: Administrative Support Role in Tampa, FL
pros:
Variety of work, some of the Leadership team are incredible, and really supportive of growth in knowledge and skills. 
Its nice to have managers willing to take your suggestions on how to improve work flow and help to put those ideas into action.
Onsite parking, very helpful when hours are unpredictable.
Cafeteria has some nice options
cons:
- No Paid National Holidays for office support staff. You have to use your own PDO all the time, and they close for multiple days, so use almost all your allocated PDO on office closures.
- No overtime at the moment, and if you do end up with overtime because your work load was excessive, they scrutinize every minute of your day to find out why you stayed. Always blame you for being inefficient
- If you resign, you only get PDO paid out at 75%, and you can't use any in your resignation period.

pros: There is ALWAYS something you can do to stand out and show your value.  Good pay.
cons: A million needs, and no staff. Everyone else has to work short, ...and when that takes a toll on you,  they just demand more and more.  For the things they put their staff through,  they should show more appreciation,  and have more realistic expectations. It's a bad cycle...Hugh turnover r/t poor staffing..r/t high turnover. Not a terrible place, just this disconnect between management and staff.  Employees never feel valued. They may need to blow budget and cater to staff, and get more agency to cover shortages. Then, maybe people will stay. Also, there is a disconnect between nursing and pt hopi. So many nurses have little to know knowledge regarding theit pts POC throughout the admission. Maybe an electronic kardex/event time line would be helpful as well. Nurses don't trust the care they provide when they have no clue why they are doing what they are doing. Luckily, sometimes the doctors know what's going on.

review_title: It's ok. Not my forever place, though. Once I get more experience I see myself moving on.
pros: Overtime and bonuses offered frequently. Savings plan for full-timers is good. Employees are friendly and fun to work with. Has potential for being better in the near future if staffing issues are solved.
cons: Extremely low pay especially for those starting out in the field. Bottom of the the bottom. You end up burning yourself out working extra hours to supplement income. They are always short-staffed which means you always have a big workload.

job_title: Medical Technologist II in Carrollwood, FL
pros: Good pay compared to area clinical laboratories. Florida Hospital is a good organization to work for. Good benefits, wonderful patient care and community involvement.
cons:
Poor management of the lab. Scratch that...horrible management. The worst I've ever had to deal with and I've been working in clinical labs for over 10 years. Because of this Carrollwood lab is chronically  understaffed.
Went from bad to worse with management. After new management took over early last year 8 employees left. I heard 2 more are in the process of leaving. This is a huge percentage of the lab staff.
Didn't realize just how unhappy I was there until I found my current position. I was willing to take a small pay cut just to get out of there.

job_title: Security I V Years in Tampa, FL
pros: The benefits were good, and most of the people the department were great people to work with. There were annual raises. Shift and weekend differential pay. People in emergency room were great to work with.
cons: Not enough people on shift, working constantly short handed. Minimum should have 1 to 3 people more on duty. When people take vacation, go on military leave,  when people get hurt hospital not willing to pay overtime. Pay compared to other facilities even other Florida hospitals less. Hard to hire quality people when pay was 10% -30% than other facilities area. Security department treated as 2nd class citizens because the department doesn't make the hospital money.  Not letting staff carry any defensive equipment batons, pepper spray, firearms, or taser. Hospital needing to take security seriously. Some doors facility wouldn't lock at night. Too many redundant checks.

pros: You can pick your own days, overtime.
cons: Management expects you do do everything with a smile on your face.

job_title: Critical Care RN in Tampa, FL
pros: Florida Hospital has become the tertiary care health center in North Tampa and has been in the process of improving existing  and adding new patient care facilities and thus it provides a large array of job opportunities for health care professionals. It is a great place to start a career and to climb up the professional ladder. FHT also offers sign on bonuses for critical care RN's as well as referral bonus.
cons: Large number of young inexperienced nurses and high employee turnover pose a challenge to establishing a highly skilled environment that yields better treatment outcome.

pros:
They pay u on time- plenty of overtime-they are always hiring-good place to get experience-
Most of the floor nurses are good people-like most places
cons: Always short handed-high patient ratio-no support from nrsg management-management doesnt know/want to take care of patients-yet tell the floor staff how we are suppose to improve hcaps-many team leaders wont help the nurses-more interested in sitting in their offices

job_title: Director of Human Resources in Tampa, FL
pros: AHS is phenomenally well run from a business perspective. I have never seen higher profit margins in a not-for-profit organization.
cons: The challenge to develop people internally is one faced by many organizations. There's a firm belief that employees should be content in their roles and not actively look to grow in the organization unless called upon.

review_title: Florida Hospital Tampa - Work in Progress
pros: Always has openings.  Good to start out to get some experience.  They are constantly trying new tactics.  Offers education, 401K, health benefits.
cons: Short staffed. High RN patient ratios.  Team leads/Charges are very young and inexperienced. Lack of experienced management.  Gets overwhelming incorporating new tactics which don't improve patient care time.  Health benefits are expensive.  Tuition reimbursement has to be approved and only up to $5,000/year.

review_title: Great for a former restaurant cook
pros: The pay for the level of work was pretty good. The hours were also relatively set, with most shifts being from early morning to early/mid afternoon. There was a lot of opportunity for overtime, and PTO was earned based on hours worked. The health benefits are pretty good.
cons: There was a contract company running the department, so the hospital's culture didn't exactly extend to the department. The overtime was almost always necessary. Management was very lax in enforcing policies and only penalized certain people. High turnover led to chaos.

pros: The only few we're having good coworkers, a convenient location close to USF, and cheap cafeteria food that's above average in quality.
cons: This is a place that will put you in immediate depression with the way it looks (old, dirty, tight) or the way it's being run (isolated and corrupt senior leadership, and non-accountable middle management).   You'll then understand why this hospital continues to receive low ratings on national scales.

pros: paying for my masters, seem to care about me,
cons: took a long time to get interview

review_title: Workplace that fulfills both professionally and emotionally
pros: Invests in team members' leadership development, supportive environment, really focuses on the happiness of the team members, CEO Denyse does "Snack and Chats" to have face time with staff of all levels (she is very accessible), listens to employee feedback, addresses patient health through the body AND mind, religious organization who puts Adventist values first but loves and cares for all regardless of background
cons: Although AdventHealth acquired UCH years ago, they are still battling some old cultural norms as they work to build their own employee culture. It seems to be improving and changing more quickly with our new CEO Denyse.

pros: I enjoy the people I work with and the culture that continues to transform in a positive way.  I have worked at AdventHealth Tampa for 5 years and before that worked at AdventHealth Wesley Chapel.  Working for Brian Adams at both facilities has been great!  He is a transformational leader with a true compassion for patients and staff that I feel is such a benefit to our organization.
cons: The biggest con I have with working at AdventHealth Tampa is the distance I drive.  I live in Lakeland so my commute is not always the highlight of my day.

review_title: I loved my job and had been at that hospital for 26 years
pros: Florida Hospital took over University Community Hospital, I started working there in 1985 and worked in only too departments. I was given the opportunity to start as patient transporter to being an Endoscopy Associate, I assisted the physician going the procedures. So there is room for advancement.
cons: I was not with Florida Hospital long enough to tell you about any real cons. I lost my job due to medical reasons.

pros: FHT is more than happy to help and grow their employees.  They are the first ones to hire someone because they are a good person rather than their experiences, and for what I've seen this is better than someone that has experience.  The education department is hands down one of the best
cons: There are a lot of changes in how things are run, and its deterring a lot of employees from continuing their careers with FHT.  Don't be discourage though, they are beginning to fix things for the better.

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Tampa, FL
pros: Opportunity for advancement, learning opportunities, Christian based, overtime available, extra-shift bonuses, nice people.
cons: Staffing shortages, increased workloads, centralized staffing model (staffing shortages on one unit affects all units).  Nurses may be forced to float to other units thus placing home units in staffing deficit.  Staffing woes lead to ill-prepared staff.

pros: Flexible schedule. Our new manager is super awesome!
cons: The units we go to can be very extreme. The urn over rate is very high so typically the floor you’ll go to will no have enough staff . It gets very difficult because the hospital requires you to do a lot.

pros: Stable company, not at risk of being bought out by another corporation. Great coworkers, availability of spiritual care is excellent
cons: No nursing unions are allowed, the charting is never ending and they’re always coming out with “one more thing” to have to document, corporate style HR where everything is done by someone off site with poor communication

pros: Great Job and co workers, great environment for learning, very friendly and easy for advancement if this is what you are seeking
cons: fast pace and you have to be willing to learn on the go. Have to be self motivated or it will seem like  you are being pushed and pulled

job_title: Director of Nursing Education in Tampa, FL
pros: Excellent CNO and Assistant CNO who are working hard to implement best practices, strong values and a clear mission, supportive of employee health and encourage vegetarian lifestyle.
cons: I come from a Magnet hospital and our hospital needs a big culture change to get to that level. But, many leaders are showing the desire and will to start that journey.

review_title: Good company but seems to be losing its Mission Direction
pros:
Great co workers
Good culture when it works
Able to promote up with hard work (to a point)
Great Values
People who work there believe in the mission
cons:
You succeed much better if you are an Adventist
Poor work life balance
Seem to be losing focus on their Mission - more directed towards profits than mission

job_title: Director of Volunteer Services in Tampa, FL
pros: Working for AdventHealth allows me the opportunity to work with our volunteers in creating an atmosphere for our patients and guest that extends the healing Ministry of Christ if you've never worked for a faith-based organization I would suggest that you try it's a wonderful experience I've been here for eight years and I wish that I will would've started 18 years ago.
cons: I have no downside for working here it's truly been a great experience

review_title: Please consider other alternatives.  CARROLLWOOD LABORATORY
pros: The pay is average, but still not enough.
cons: The amount of stress you get from working here will change your life, the health of my fellow coworkers and I has dropped tremendously. You will be disrespected, talked down to, lied to. Your schedule will be changed all the time, your hours cut, then overworked due to the high turnover rate.  The management plays favorites to a fault, the work atmosphere suffers and the rest of the unit makes up for all discrepancies that occur.

review_title: Great but always room for improvment
pros: Flexible hours, friendly staff, pdo,  great work-life balance, and many career opportunities.
cons: Many level of policies within the organization, difficulty getting tuition reimbursement, job security sometimes an issue, quick management turnover and forced to take pdo for non holidays.

pros: Working from home with flexible hours. Co-workers were great. Medical benefits were good. CEO is a great speaker, very nice and informative at meetings.
cons: Direct manager played favorites. Supposed to be an "open door policy" but they really didn't care about employees' concerns/needs. Employees are underpaid and not appreciated or treated the way they should be. Not many opportunities to move up. Some co-workers were catty and malicious. No paid holidays.

pros:
-good pay
-nice facility 
-Christian affiliated, but does not push views on patient or employees
-kind staff
cons: For me I had a hard time figuring out my orientation schedule as I wasn’t just communicating with one person form my unit, I was told a different person to contact 3-4 times. But once I finally was able to contact someone they were very responsive.

pros: Good company and great coworkers .  The company tries to show its appreciation by giving many perks to its employees.
cons: Very stressful environment. Over worked due heavy patient load. Too many bosses and not enough real workers. Everyone is good at telling others what to do.

pros: Great community of healthcare workers, Faith based company allows us to pray for our patients and families, Our mission and values are patient centered.
cons: Sometimes it takes a long time to implement a process change.

review_title: Large company mostly concerned with bottom line.
pros: Coworkers and direct supervisors were mostly decent and hard-working with few exceptions.
cons: Poor performers were not dealt with adequately resulting in a negative work environment. Poor pay for dangerous job duties in a busy hospital. Upper management has little concern with employee workload. Security is short staffed with no signs of getting better. Most policies are outdated and need revision.

review_title: Not a terrible place to work but depending on department it can go both ways
pros:
competitive pay  and yearly wages no matter performance for nursing staff
updated facility
cons:
upper management really only care about the bottom line 
and will always take patient/ family members side regardless of the situation

pros: I cannot think of any pros . The time I  spent working there was beyond normal stress on the job. RN's, like myself,  are used to being very busy and multitasking. It was the bullying and the insulting treatment received that ruined my employment experience. They took advantage of my caring
cons: New management says they are all about providing compassionate, professional and  spiritual healthcare to patients but it is a fake facade. Behind the scenes, it's all about getting patients through as fast as possible. Nursing staff is treated miserably by a few abusive and dishonest so called managers. It is disgusting how RN"s and staff are bullied and mistreated by a few power hungry, lazy so called managers. I hated working there. The only saving grace were the patients and trying to provide the best care possible even when I had had no lunch break or requests for relief were ignored. No praise ever given for a job well done or for staying extra hours when staff was short due to poor planning. So called managers always had their breaks and left on time or took off for personal reasons. Whereas, if RN's or staff had urgent personal requests, we were eyed like we were lying. It was ridiculous to have grown adult professionals treated with such disrespect. Several  of the more experienced RN"s and staff were accused falsely of not doing their jobs and either left due to the bullying and pressure or were fired. One day they were there, the next day gone. The fact that a few dishonest managers have so much power and can  get away with such illegal, inappropriate treatment of RN's and staff is shocking. From the outside the hospital and it's ads are very convincing that it is a safe,desirable place to go but the constant back biting and fears of losing jobs behind the scenes is dangerous because it is distracting to staff trying to actually do their jobs. I am glad I no longer work there.  I should have left several years ago.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Tampa, FL
pros:
You'll be rewarded by helping patients heal! The company pays well and the benefits are better than most.
The clinic I work in has good atmosphere and the management makes sure we have the tools needed to do a good job.
cons: None that I'm worried about!

pros: Great Clinical Staff, they are the only reason why I stayed for as long as I did.
cons:
Business Management do not care about patient care
Pay is way lower than the value, everything runs off of the navigators
Busy work is given when there is already enough work to do 
High Turnover Rate

review_title: Could certainly be better, but it's definitely not the worst
pros: Given a lot of opportunities for advancement and feel appreciated
cons: Management has a constantly revolving door and there's not much communication to staff

pros: Great bonuses and wellness program incentives. Like their faith oriented care.
cons: Doesn't put funds toward immediate expansion needs instead adds extra buildings without first fixing the original and putting more pressure on staff during long reno.

pros: Love my co workers and that's mainly it.
cons: Horrible management. They write you up if you drop a pencil on the floor. Such nonsense. Patients do not come first. Nurses are harassed and treated unfairly. Definitely racism at this hospital. There mission statement is all words with no action.

pros: Friendly atmosphere, much involvement and encouragement from upper management, the patient always comes first, the experience that brings people back
cons: Nothing that i have encountered so far. Would love to get paid more but dont we all?

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Tampa, FL
pros: Some, but not all, great reasons to work here are the benefits, flexible schedules, proximity to home, and fun activities (there's usually something every or every other month).
cons: Bureaucracy of working for large organization. Not enough staff.

pros: Growth opportunities and employee benefits are a few pros.
cons: The entire organization could benefit from more structure and organization, at times great concepts and ideas get lost or forgotten in the shuffle.

pros: Great coworkers, honestly not much else
cons: short staffed, heavy patient loads, nitpicky management, cafeteria food is $$$ with no employee discount, health benefits are terrible, have to punch in and out for lunch

pros: Very Supportive staff	. Expanding. Renovating the hospital. Very good nursing staff. Very good or staff. Trying to bring in the new generation.
cons: Trying , not getting professional staff. Pay is not good. Benefits not known. Work is under appreciated. Stuck up in policies

pros: FHT is focused on bringing quality healthcare to the community.  They have made major steps in adding new services for the community with new E/R and Pediatrics program.  Employee engagement and town hall meetings improve communication and employee retention.
cons: Work life balance can be an issue.

cons: parking horrible for employees, elevators don’t work, tube system always fails, departments don’t communicate, upper management is not considerate of its employee input, salary not competitive. just check VA and Moffitt

pros: The co workers kept me there

review_title: Love the company...limited opportunities for advancement....limited compensation, but it is acute care

review_title: Gone downhill since they took over University Community Hospital
pros: Great Dental and Prescription benefits. Very large and growing organization within the Adventist Healthcare System. Flexible work schedules depending on the nursing unit.
cons: Low paying and bad medical insurance. Limited career growth within the organization. They will tell you one thing while they do another . Do not really care about your family well-being, but will try to push their Adventist beliefs off on you.

pros: Pay is good, benefits are average. Several locations in Bay Area.
cons: Unprofessional, negative and  discouraging upper management. They manage by intimidation. (I.e. Instead of working to develop their associates, they threaten the email employees  job when associate is not meeting expectations.)

pros:

review_title: They do not live up to their vision, mission and values.

pros: I have learned so much from my position and the colleagues that I work with. Everyone is very helpful and team oriented.

pros: Some of the pharmacists are cool to work with.

pros: A unwavering culture to help others with a focus on restoring the the whole person both physically, mentally and spiritually
